Posts.Content: Aug 11, 2009 11:30PM ronnyjay wrote: Sparrow, I also had intense anxiety in the beginning - - and I am one of those people who rarely worries about anything.   But the day of my diagnosis, I felt like I had been pushed off a cliff and would never stop falling.   Couldn't eat, sleep or sit still for an entire week.   The only thing that helped was talking to those who cared.  (And everyone here does care so much! ) The MRI was actually relaxing for me - - even though it was pretty noisy, I fell asleep.  And since I was laying face down when they moved the MRI tunnel over me, I wasn't even aware that I was enclosed, so there was no claustrophobia.  I'm still pretty new to BC  - had the masectomy just a month ago, so the people I meet in these forums are so wonderful because of all the experiences and advice that they share.  Do let us know how you're doing, and  you can vent all you want with us!
Posts.Title: I just can't deal with this Sparrow one-L
